name: 70 park avenue hotel - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: Well below the expected standard for Kimptons. 4 foot by 3 feet deep front desk. Lobby that is smaller than my master closet. Terribly beat up elevators. The bathroom could not have been any smaller. A/c that did not operate. really a poor level for $430 a night, and so I checked out early. In summary, a pretty beat up old hotel that is not maintained very well.
reviews.title: Disappointing KImpton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My bf and I just love 70 Park with their newly renovated rooms. The staff is friendly and we always get excellent services. The hotel is located on a quiet side of Park Avenue and therefore gives you some kind of break after a day of shopping and partying. You also get to live like a wealthy New Yorker. Only downside: 2 very slow and old elevators that take forever, especially after free wine hour.
reviews.title: Love 70 Park

reviews.text: I attended a conference in Manhattan. I booked the Hotel 70 because it was a Kimpton property, close to the conference venue, and was offering a good rate. When I checked in I was provided a queen deluxe room on the 11th floor. There is an odd layout to the rooms on the floors, with my room being directly across from the stairwell, but I did not have any additional room noise because of that. The room was huge for NYC standards and very nicely decorated. There was plenty of storage in the room and the double window allowed a lot of light into the room. The bathroom was small, as said in other reviews, but again not excessively small by NYC standards.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Convenient Location

reviews.text: I did have several issues with the room, but all were probably maintenance issues. With a hotel of this age I can imagine how difficult it must be to maintain everything. The most problematic issue was the temperature of the room. Even with the thermostat set at 65 degrees the room never got below 72. At this temperature it was very difficult for me to sleep. After the first night I opened the window in the evening to cool down the room for sleeping. I did not report this issue to the hotel staff as I felt there was little that could be done about it. On my first morning I had no cold water in the bathroom. I reported this and it was repaired by the time I returned that evening. I rolled down the window blind and it would not roll up the next morning. Also fixed within hours. Because it is an older hotel the hot water does not get above tepid and it took a long time (10-15 minutes) for it to get to the 11th floor. But it was sufficient to have a comfortable shower.
reviews.title: Kimpton hotels never disappoint!

reviews.text: All of the staff were exceptionally helpful with a special note to the concierge. She went out of her way to provide all the information I needed. As with all Kimpton Hotels the evening wine hour and morning coffee are extremely welcome after a hard day and a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Wonderful....

reviews.text: We have been to New York 3 times now , and this is the best hotel we have stayed in , friendly helpful staff , really nice rooms and a great location . We will return there next time in New York
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Read loads of reviews on loads of hotels before taking the plunge on this one. I found a decent price on cityandshow.com and they gave me good information about the hotel and made some great restaurant recommendations.
reviews.title: Love It
Very $$$$ hotel that serves Beringer wine....
reviews.text: The hotel is decent, really clean, staff helpful and in a nice quiet (if that is possible) part of the City, but within reach of all the keys sites. The rooms are decked out nicely and the bed was lovely and comfortable. The hotel also has a drinks hour for all guests which is a lovely touch and starts the evening off well. I would certainly recommend this place and would stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my last day at this hotel I took advantage of the "free" wine hour in the lobby and after paying over $500/night I got a glass of undrinkable Beringer wine. Is that the best they can do when they're raking in that kind of dough? Do they not value their clientele enough to serve them anything better than supermarket wine? Looking at the wallpaper (made to look like marble?) and the 80's formica coffee table covered in wallpaper (which was peeling), I felt like that I'd been had....Everything about the experience felt cheap....You can stay in some wonderful hotels in NYC for $500 -- think grande dame, Central Park, real marble lobby, etc. This place is a knock-off and not a very good one.
reviews.title: Nice hotel
Eh.
reviews.text: 70 Park Avenue hotel is a nice hotel in a nice area. We stayed in a King Deluxe room. The mattress is super comfortable and the room is very clean. By New York standards it is also quite spacious. The staff was very courteous and quick to help. The hotel is conveniently located by Grand Central station and the Empire State Building. The hotel is older and the floors squeaked but other than that I have no complaints. We booked through using a code from travelzoo for $200 a night and felt it was a good deal. I would stay there again in the future.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, amazing location
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic. We got a king deluxe for $200 per night off travelzoo. I cannot understand why anyone would complain when looking at the other reviews. Room was fantastic, lovely decor and very clean. Communal areas were spotless and a wine reception was help every night in the lobby. I cannot complain about anything, I only have good things to say about the place. When I return to NYC I will definatley stay here.

reviews.title: Brilliant
reviews.text: Location great too, just a few blocks from Grand Central.
All in all a great hotel
reviews.title: Thank you for everything!!

reviews.text: OK, so I am a fussy traveller as you will see from some of my other reviews but I am confused as to why there are several bad posts on this hotel. As a regular Kimpton guest I was not dissapointed and found the room superb. The decor was stylish and the room was actually quite big. I can only guess from some of the other comments that the guests are from the parts of the world where space is not at a premium, where rooms are huge and in most other US HOTELS you could call it an apartment. New York hotel rooms are all small and it is something you have to accept. Or alternatively pay in excess of $700 per night. I was also impressed with the food and service and in Particular, there was a lovely gentleman concierge with a gorgeous dog who was fantastic. If you want a hotel in a good position and great service then pick this one.
reviews.title: The worst hotel I have stayed in.

reviews.text: I have never posted or rated any sort of service on the internet before but felt I had to say something here.
reviews.title: OK hotel, but I'd probably look elsewhere next time

reviews.text: Have just returned from a three night stay in this hotel. The location was perfect to explore New York . The staff were friendly, helpful and polite. Our room was lovely and clean with comfortable beds and enough space. The bathroom was a little small and would benefit from a makeover. I do agree with another review about the lobby being cold,we sat for a short period of time and it was freezing. Overall this is a good hotel and well priced.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: Stayed with my family four three nights. While all was not exactly in order on checking into our room, the staff was ever attentive and quick to respond to our needs and concerns. The room itself was update to date and comfortable and the location was within easy walking distance of many sight seeing attractions.
reviews.title: Nice Stay at 70 Park Avenue

reviews.text: Me and my wife really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It has just perfect location to explore New York on foot, or by using the Subway network. Our room was quite small, but it was very cousy and clean, and obviously very recently refurbished. Hotel was peaceful, and the daily vine reception was very nice.. We can easily recommend this hotelli to anybody visiting New York.
reviews.title: Location, location, location..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here in october 2011. The good points.Good location-near Grand Central Station, Times Square and shops and underground station. Free wine in reception between 5pm and 6pm. Comfortable bed.
reviews.title: GOOD AND BAD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad points
reviews.title: Great Location in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here because this is a "Kimpton" hotel, which I have always had good experiences with. Not this place. The hallways are barely wide enough to navigate. (Might want to skip meals for a week before you get there, the elevator could pass for a coffin.) For our $600 bucks a night for three nights, we got a dingy room with visible stains on the bedding, a bathroom barely big enough to enter, and a cleaning staff that attempted to pilfer my ipod. Don't bother with this place. You'd be better off at a La Qunita (and would have $1500 left over).
reviews.title: You've got to be kidding me . . .

reviews.text: I enjoyed the hotel, but I think I'd go elsewhere next time. It wasn't very exciting, but it was a nice base, especially if it is your first time in New York. The staff are very helpful and friendly and the hotel is within walking distance to Grand Central Station and the Empire State Building.
reviews.title: Sweet Hotel

likes.liked: — The friendly staff, good location and buffet breakfast.
likes.disliked: — Our room faced into the lightwell and was quite dark.

reviews.text: The hotel interior was modern and funky, and our room had the coolest portable lights. The buffet breakfast was also very nice. For a good dinner, I'd recommend Todai, an all you can eat sushi buffet near the Empire State Building!
reviews.title: Good hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed in a double double room at the hotel. It was cramped, but compensated for this with excellent features such as a 42" TV, excellent L'Occitane toiletries and an iPod speaker/alarm clock, although a larger room would be a requirement for a future stay.
reviews.title: I'll Be Back!

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and there are computers that you can use in the lobby, (for an extortionate price). The breakfast is very mediocre, and there is a similarly priced alternative called the Central Cafe, opposite Grand Central station, (which is just down the street) that serves the best pancakes on Earth. When you are so close to one of the best breakfasts in NYC, there is no excuse not to try the Central Cafe!
reviews.title: Park Avenue Ordinary

likes.liked: — The location to Grand Central Station
likes.disliked: — The indiffence of the desk staff

reviews.text: Booked for a 1 night stay (King Deluxe). First time in a Kimpton NYC property (have stayed before in their San Francisco hotels which are also quite good). Although this is not one of their newer properties in NY, the room and lobby decor appeared to be newly renovated. There are several elevators in the hotel and although they are on the small side, they are very quick so no endless waiting to get one.
reviews.title: 70 Park Ave Doesn't Disappoint

reviews.text: For a NYC hotel, the size of the room was very ample and there was plenty of space to walk around both sides and the foot of the bed. The room had a nice wing chair to sit and read as well as a desk and a new flat screen TV. The bathroom is small and even though the tub is a little smaller than a standard tub, they made the most of the space by using a curved shower rod curtain so there's plenty of elbow room to shower. If you are a very light sleeper, bring earplugs as the walls are not that thick and you can hear some noise from your neighbors (also, even though the hotel is completely non-smoking, some inconsiderate hotel guest nearby was definitely smoking in their room as we smelled some cigar smoke in our room for about 10 minutes).
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.text: The location was great. Easy to grab a taxi right outside the front door and a short walk to Grand Central and the subway. Walkable to much of Midtown and the theater district, yet this part of Park Ave is just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square so other than some light traffic on Park Avenue the neighborhood is not noisy late at night.and there is no construction going on anywhere nearby which ensures a quiet morning. Valet parking is a bit expensive ($62 for SUVs), but the valet staff was quick about taking the car as soon as we pulled up. It does take about 15-20 minutes to retrieve the car, so plan accordingly if you need to be somewhere else after checking out. Front desk staff and concierge very pleasant. Coffee and tea available in the lobby during the morning, flavored waters and fruit available 24/7 in lobby, we didn't have time to partake of the evening wine hour but we did have a drink in the Silverleaf Tavern downstairs which had a nice bar area as well as a decent selection of small plates for late night munchies. The female bartender was a little bit slow filling drink orders from patrons not seated immediately at the bar in front of her and we watched one couple come in and get frustrated at waiting and they left (we went up to the bar to order and brought our drinks over to the banquettes). Being a Kimpton InTouch member got us the free WiFi in our room and they fulfilled all my stated preferences for a high floor room away from the elevators and with hypo-allergenic foam pillows. Kimpton InTouch also noticed my birthday had just taken place a few days before and they put a lovely birthday cake and a bottle of Brut in our room along with a coupon for $15 in mini-bar items from the General Manager.
reviews.title: A comfortable stay in NYC

reviews.text: I'd definitely book again at 70 Park Avenue
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A decent hotel in an excellent central location. Front desk service and concierge were both very good. The king deluxe room was a great size but the bathroom was a huge disappointment - average shower over bath, plastic shower curtain etc...Though this is billed as a boutique hotel don't expect cutting edge design. It's a safe option though and a good base for exploring the city.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, Lots of street noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With everything within walking distance this hotel is a gem. Perfect for a first timer who wants to get around New York the only way - on foot!
reviews.title: So Close To Everything - Perfect For A FIrst Timer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bad:
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — It was clean and very cosy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much really...
reviews.title: Great location, nice extras

reviews.text: The ‘Run of the Mill’:
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are not massive but this is New York. The bathroom is INCREDIBLY small, but still functional - albeit for one person.
reviews.title: Great location for City sights

reviews.text: a great location, step out of the hotel look left and you see grand central terminal "brilliant".
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: the rooms are small, but most are in nyc - you only need to sleep. the hotel staff are the friendliest ever. They make a point of making you feel valued with little gestures and remebering small details which matter. We were given a lovely warm welcome...it was like coming home, i asked if we could make coffee in the room after a long flight the receptionist sent someone up with a coffee machine - he was there before i got the door open (service or what).
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: the wine hour between 5 and 6pm every evening is a lovely touch its friendly informal and a great idea to get you chatting with your fellow guests (good to find out best options in the city).
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: there was a restaurant next door - well attached to the hotel for breakfast and meals if required, we did have breakfast there twice which was lovely, good food - good service - and good value for money.
reviews.title: Quiet and private in the heart of Murray Hill

reviews.text: the location is great next to grand central but quiet 200metres from 42nd street - from our room we could view the empire state building.
reviews.title: Great home base for exploring New York

description: Centrally located in midtown Manhattan, 70 park avenue hotel is a luxurious urban hideaway where guests "live life well." Ideal for business and leisure travelers alike, this intimate boutique hotel offers gracious personalized service in stylish surroundings. This Kimpton Hotel is convenient to Grand Central Station, Fifth Avenue shopping, Rockefeller Center, Broadway, museums and nightlife, and the adjacent silverleaf tavern draws a lively, cosmopolitan crowd.
